title: Survey on Source-coding technique. (arXiv:2211.00230v2 [cs.IT] UPDATED)
description: Shannon separation theorem lays the foundation for traditional image compression and transmission schemes, which consist of JPEG type image compression methods and the usual channel coding schemes such as Turbo and LDPC codes. One of the advantages of the separate design is that each of the two components, channel coding and source coding can be handled independently without considering the other, which is the base of decades-long technologies.
dc:creator: Weida Wang
